meanings.definition: In a very unhappy or unfortunate state
meanings.sent1: The puppy looked wretchedly after getting caught in the rain.
meanings.sent2: She felt wretchedly when she lost her favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The clown's wretchedly sad face made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood wretchedly abandoned at the end of the street.
meanings.sent5: The wretchedly lonely boy sat by himself at lunchtime.

meanings.definition: In a very poor or inferior manner
meanings.sent1: He sang wretchedly during the talent show.
meanings.sent2: The car was wretchedly maintained and constantly broke down.
meanings.sent3: The cake was wretchedly decorated, but it tasted delicious.
meanings.sent4: The team played wretchedly, losing every game of the season.
meanings.sent5: The student performed wretchedly on the exam despite studying hard.
